revised_title: Metabelian Groups of Prime-Power Exponent: Structure and Nilpotency
tldr: The authors study metabelian groups of prime-power exponent, showing that the subgroup generated by the powers of elements in these groups is nilpotent. They also provide an upper bound for the nilpotency class of these groups in terms of the number of generators and the exponent. This research contributes to the understanding of the structure and properties of metabelian groups.
